prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing movie ratings:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "MovieID": ["M01", "M02", "M03", "M04", "M05", "M06", "M07", "M08"],
    "Title": ["Inception", "The Dark Knight", "Pulp Fiction", "Forrest Gump", "The Matrix", "Interstellar", "The Lion King", "Fight Club"],
    "Genre": ["Sci-Fi", "Action", "Crime", "Drama", "Sci-Fi", "Sci-Fi", "Animation", "Drama"],
    "Year": [2010, 2008, 1994, 1994, 1999, 2014, 1994, 1999],
    "Rating": [8.8, 9.0, 8.9, 8.8, 8.7, 8.6, 8.5, 8.8],
    "Votes": [2200000, 2500000, 1900000, 1800000, 1700000, 1600000, 900000, 2000000]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Calculate a "WeightedRating" for each movie using the formula: ("Rating" * "Votes") / (sum of all "Votes"). 2) Add this "WeightedRating" as a new column to the DataFrame. 3) Print the "Title" and "WeightedRating" of the movie with the highest "WeightedRating". Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame, calculate the WeightedRating as specified, add it as a new column, and identify the movie with the highest WeightedRating.
